item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:3, topic:536426”]There’s quite a few ways to do this but depending on what you needed stored then probably the best and most modern way is to use HTML5 storage, take a look at this article. You could also do it through quite a few other ways, storing a unique key in a cookie on the users computer, having that cookie accessed then the unique key corresponding to data in the database. This method isn’t 100% secure to all users since cookies can be modified but for a game like that it doesn’t work too badly.[/quote]It’s pretty unnecessary to use server side storage for completely client sided games or application. I think local storage would be the best approach.
